body_html: We normally use the bfloat16_scope to automatically adjust operations inside, e.g.: with tf.contrib.tpu.bfloat16_scope(): x = y * z You can also specify an explicit `dtype` on some ops, or cast the inputs to bfloat16 (ops preserve the type of their inputs).
body_text:
We normally use the bfloat16_scope to automatically adjust operations
inside, e.g.:

with tf.contrib.tpu.bfloat16_scope():
  x = y * z

You can also specify an explicit `dtype` on some ops, or cast the inputs to
bfloat16 (ops preserve the type of their inputs).
body:
We normally use the bfloat16_scope to automatically adjust operations
inside, e.g.:

with tf.contrib.tpu.bfloat16_scope():
  x = y * z

You can also specify an explicit `dtype` on some ops, or cast the inputs to
bfloat16 (ops preserve the type of their inputs).
